meanings.definition: The position or role of being a duenna.
meanings.sent1: In the play, the duennaship of the character was crucial to the storyline.
meanings.sent2: Her duennaship over the household was respected by all the servants.
meanings.sent3: The duennaship of the strict nanny made the children behave.
meanings.sent4: She held onto her duennaship like a queen holding her crown.
meanings.sent5: The duennaship of the wise elder was a source of guidance for the community.

meanings.definition: The authority or control exercised by a duenna.
meanings.sent1: The duennaship of the headmistress ensured order in the school.
meanings.sent2: His duennaship over the team was unquestioned.
meanings.sent3: The duennaship of the librarian extended to the overdue book fines.
meanings.sent4: She wielded her duennaship like a sword, cutting through any disobedience.
meanings.sent5: The duennaship of the coach led the team to victory.

meanings.definition: The characteristics or qualities associated with a duenna.
meanings.sent1: Her duennaship was marked by kindness and wisdom.
meanings.sent2: The duennaship of the old lady was known for her strictness.
meanings.sent3: The duennaship of the cat included a love for napping in the sun.
meanings.sent4: She carried herself with the duennaship of a queen, commanding respect.
meanings.sent5: The duennaship of the teacher was evident in her patience with the students.
